snippet: Officials say the suspects’ Facebook messages outlined more than three years of tit-for-tat warfare among three gangs.
abstract: Indictments are unsealed in State Supreme Court in Manhattan against 63 members of three East Harlem gangs, involved in shooting war that began in October 2009, that have brought terrorized neighborhood; all but eight of whom are under 20 years of age, with 49 facing life in prison on charge of conspiracy to commit murder.
lead_paragraph: Officials say the suspects’ Facebook messages outlined more than three years of tit-for-tat warfare among three gangs.

headline.seo: 63 in E. Harlem Gangs Indicted in Revenge Shootings
headline.main: 63 Gang Members Indicted in East Harlem Shootings
headline.print_headline: 63 Gang Members Indicted In East Harlem Shootings
